content.description: This is a new variation of the classic Coffin problem.  Start in the coffin shaped hueco and move out to the lip.  But, instead of traversing up and out by way of the obvious rail to the left, continue going right.

Ren starts on the next roof section to the right of Baby Coffin, start back on the skirt on underclings, move into the roof undercling/pockets and throw to a sloper on the lip. From here figure out how to top out with out dabbing.

Start in the hole and make a big move to obvious sloped rail. From here use baby coffin style movement to establish on that rail and go up to jugs. The top out is the easiest part of the route which is good because falling off would be a trip to the glue factory for sure. Skirt is off.
content.location: Far left side of the roof about 10 feet to the left of baby coffin under the same poopy roof.

content.description: A formerly obscure roof, now somewhat popular. Sometimes referred to as "Baby Coffin." Start in the namesake hueco and head for the lip, fighting the dab.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter to keep you from rolling down the hill, should things go totally awry.
content.location: On the left side of the roof, starting on the obvious large coffin-shaped hueco.

content.description: The Coffin Roof (aka Ren and Stimpy Roof?) is tucked away in the trees on the rarely visited left side of the Draw. The main attraction is The Coffin, a hidden gem named for the huge, coffin-shaped starting hueco. There are a few other short problems in this roof that look okay, but I don't know anything about them.
